attributes.title: Stock verification
attributes.description:
A stock take exercise was conducted on 1st June 2025 to assess the effectiveness of internal controls that are put in place to safeguard company assets.                 
                
The findings revealed a cumulative bread variance of -35.5 loaves and polybags had a cumulative variance of +367 pieces.
attributes.recommendation: Stock controls are effective and need to be maintained.

value: The positive trend will be maintained
This is noted and we will strive to do better.
In the previous audit, the finished products had a cumulative shortfall of 20 loaves and polybags had a positive variance of 1,525 pieces.
Stock controls are effective as no material variance was noted in most of the inventory items.

attributes.title: Bread weigt check
attributes.description:
Sample varieties of packed bread were randomly picked and weighed to establish whether the branch adheres to weights and measures standards.                            
                            
All sample varieties had few cases of underweight.                             
The underweight samples were spread as follows; 400g BT- 04%, 400g Br-02%, 600g W-02%, 800g W- 06% and 800g Br- 03%.

value: We will continue making improvements.
To be maintained
Minimal cases of underweight were noted in the previous audit spot check.
Minimal cases of underweight is an indication that production standards are observed.

attributes.title: Damages Analysis
attributes.description:
Analysis of bread damages from 10.05.25 – 31.05.25 was done to verify if the level of bread damages was maintained within the set limits of 0.25% of the total production and 0.2% of the total sales.                         
                        
A total of 373 loaves were damaged under production damages which represent 0.22% of the total loaves produced which is within the acceptable range.                        
                        
171 loaves were damaged under market damages representing 0.15% of the total sales over the audited period. Both production and market damages were maintained within the allowable limits.
attributes.recommendation: The management should ensure that both production and market damages are maintained within the set limits

value: The positive trend will be maintained
To be maintained
Both production and market damages were maintained within the set limits in the previous audit findings
Both production and market damages were maintained within the set limits indicating that the company is not exposed to losses due to damages.

attributes.title: Cash verification
attributes.description:
A spot check was conducted at the branch cash office to assess the adequacy of cash handling practices and if proper records were maintained. 

The cash count exercise  revealed no material variances between the physical cash on hand and the book balance.
attributes.recommendation: The branch should ensure that petty cash records and balances are well maintained.

value: The positive trend will be maintained.
The positive trend will be maintained.
No variances were reported in the cash office in the previous audit findings.
The immaterial variance noted in cash office is an indication that effective controls are in place.

attributes.title: Production Efficiency
attributes.description:
Production efficiency was analyzed from 10.05.25 – 31.05.25 to find out if the branch achieved the set efficiency of 5 bags per worker.                        
                        
The branch hired a total of 180 workers over the audited period hence the expected production was 900 bags.                        
                        
The actual production was 894 bags leading to an actual efficiency was 4.97 bags per worker which is within the range.
attributes.recommendation: Management to maintain proper planning of production workers.

value: To be maintained
To be maintained
The production efficiency reported in the previous audit findings was 4.87 bags per worker
The set efficiency was achieved indicating that the planned production labour cost was observed.

attributes.title: Packaging Efficiency
attributes.description:
Production and packaging efficiency were analyzed from 10.05.25 – 31.05.25 to find out if the branch achieved the set efficiency of 97 crates per worker.                                
                                
The total good bread produced over the audited period is 11,472 crates hence the expected slicers to be hired was 118 workers.                                 
                                
A total of 113 workers were hired leading to an actual efficiency was 101 crates per worker which is within the range.
attributes.recommendation: Management to maintain the proper planning of production workers to ensure that the set efficiency is always achieved.

value: To bemaintained
To bemaintained
The production efficiency reported in the previous audit findings was 94.9 crates per worker
Packaging efficiency was analyzed from 10.05.25 – 31.05.25 to find out if the branch achieved the set efficiency of 97 crates per worker.
The set efficiency was achieved indicating that the planned packaging cost was observed.

attributes.title: Delivery vehicle fuel usage efficiency
attributes.description:
Analysis of fuel consumption by the delivery vehicles was done for the month of May 2025 to verify if their consumption rate is within the set standards.                        
                        
Analysis was done for the two vehicles assigned to the branch KCN 097M and KCJ 335L. Comparison of the actual fuel used and the standard fuel revealed immaterial variances.
attributes.recommendation: The set controls on fuel usage should be strictly adhered.

value: We will maintain
The positive trend will be maintained.
Fuel consumption was within the range for the two vehicles in the previous audit findings.
Fuel consumption rates are within the range indicating that fuel controls are being observed.

attributes.title: Generator fuel consumption analysis
attributes.description:
Review of generator fuel usage and machine hours records was done to ascertain that its use is as per the set policies.
Standard fuel consumption for the branch generator was 26.6 L/Hr
The generator had run for 37.4 hours and used 880 litres of fuel over the period from 1st April to 30th May 2025.
The average rate of fuel consumption was 23.53 L/Hr which is within the  range.

value: To be maintained.
To be maintained.
The average fuel consumption rate reported in the previous audit findings was 22.99 L/Hr.
No material variance is noted indicating that proper generator controls are in place.

attributes.title: Stock verification
attributes.description: Stock take to check if physical count matches with balance
